dataObject.content: Samoa on Thursday closed all non-essential public and private services for two days to combat a measles epidemic that has killed more than 60 people, mostly babies and children, in a battle complicated by a vocal anti-vaccination movement.

annotationData.content: {"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"i thought this passage is wright and best one"}
{"category":{"label":"Unbiased"},"rationale":"To say that to battle is complicated by vocal anti-vaccination movement seems trustable and belivable. Unbiased."}
